Kampung Beting, Dari Sarang Narkoba Menjadi Kawasan Wisata Religi
07 Nov 2019, 02:01 by Agus Wijananto


Kampung Beting, Dari Sarang Narkoba Menjadi Kawasan Wisata Religi

KBRN, Pontianak : Kampung Beting yang berada di kota Pontianak selama ini kerap dianggap sebagai salah satu sarang peredaran Narkoba. Data BNN juga memasukkan wilayah ini sebagai salah satu dari 23 kawasan rawan peredaran gelap Narkoba di Kalimantan Barat.Dalam kunjungan kerja ke Kesultanan Pontianak,  Kepala BNN Heru Winarko mengatakan Kampung Beting memiliki potensi untuk dibangun menjadi kawasan wisata religi. "Kita bisa mencontoh Singapura, di Kampung Arab di sana, masjid selain menjadi tempat sholat juga tujuan wisata bagi turis asing," ujar Heru di Pontianak, Rabu (6/112019).Masjid Jami Pontianak atau dikenal dengan nama Masjid Sultan Syarif Abdurrahman adalah masjid tertua dan terbesar di Pontianak. Masjid yang dekat dengan Istana Kesultanan (Keraton Kadriyah) ini merupakan satu dari dua bangunan yang menjadi pertanda berdirinya Kota Pontianak pada tahun 1771 Masehi.Menurut Heru, Kampung Beting menjadi salah satu fokus program pemberdayaan alternatif di wilayah perkotaan. Bentuk pemberdayaan yang dilakukan bagi masyarakat di sini adalah dengan memberikan pelatihan pembuatan produk kerajinan tangan. Sementara itu Sultan IX Pontianak Syarif Mahmud Melvin Alkadri menyambut positif dan ucapan terima kasih atas kehadiran program BNN di wilayahnya. "Semoga melalui upaya-upaya ini dapat membawa hal positif, terkait maraknya Narkoba di wilayah Kalimantan Barat," kata Sultan.Senada dengan Sultan, Walikota Pontianak Edi Rusdi Kamtono yang turut hadir mengatakan bahwa masyarakat Kampung Beting cenderung tidak mengakui bahwa wilayahnya termasuk dalam kategori rawan Narkoba, mereka merasa aman dan nyaman dengan kondisi saat ini. "Kita akan kaget pada saat membaca berita di media massa, biasanya kasus Narkoba yang terjadi di wilayah ini mempunyai relevansi dengan kriminalitas," ungkap Edi. Oleh karenanya, menurut Edi, Pemkot Pontianak berkomitmen untuk terus menjalin sinergi dengan BNN Kota Pontianak setiap tahunnya. "Kita rutin lakukan tes urine bagi ASN, sopir truk, pekerja tempat hiburan malam dan cafe-cafe. Dari 4600 orang yang kita tes, 1 orang positif terpapar Narkoba," jelasnya.Edi menambahkan bahwa pihaknya juga melakukan pengentasan kawasan kumuh seluas kurang lebih 24 hektar, melalui program bedah rumah, WC dan lingkungan.  "Salah satu lokasi program kita adalah Kampung Beting ini. Kita upayakan kampung ini menjadi kawasan yang tertata dan teratur, tidak kumuh," tandas Edi. Saat ini, Pontianak memiliki jumlah penduduk sekitar 664.000 orang, yang terbagi dalam 6 kecamatan, 29 kelurahan. Kampung Beting berada di Kecamatan Pontianak Timur, suatu wilayah ketiga terbesar di Pontianak dan sangat padat.Edi berharap melalui kolaborasi pemerintah kota dengan BNN ini kedepannya dapat  menghilangkan stigma Kampung Beting sebagai kawasan rawan Narkoba.

Beting Village, From a Drug Nest into a Religious Tourism Area
Nov 7 2019, 02:01 by Agus Wijananto


Beting Village, From a Drug Nest into a Religious Tourism Area

KBRN, Pontianak: The Beting Village in Pontianak city has always been considered as one of the drug distribution nests. BNN data also included this area as one of 23 areas prone to illicit trafficking of narcotics in West Kalimantan. During a working visit to the Pontianak Sultanate, BNN Head Heru Winarko said Kampung Beting had the potential to be developed into a religious tourism area. "We can imitate Singapore, in the Arab Village there, the mosque besides being a place of prayer is also a tourist destination for foreign tourists," said Heru in Pontianak, Wednesday (6/112019) .Jami Mosque in Pontianak or known by the name of Sultan Syarif Abdurrahman Mosque is a mosque the oldest and largest in Pontianak. The mosque which is close to the Sultanate Palace (Kadriyah Palace) is one of the two buildings that marked the establishment of Pontianak City in 1771 AD. According to Heru, Kampung Beting became one of the focuses of alternative empowerment programs in urban areas. The form of empowerment undertaken for the community here is to provide training in the manufacture of handicraft products. Meanwhile Sultan IX Pontianak Syarif Mahmud Melvin Alkadri welcomed positively and thanked for the presence of the BNN program in his region. "Hopefully, through these efforts can bring positive things, related to the rise of narcotics in the region of West Kalimantan," said the Sultan. As well as the Sultan, Pontianak Mayor Edi Rusdi Kamtono who was also present said that the community of Kampong Beting tends not to recognize that the area is included in the vulnerable category Drugs, they feel safe and comfortable with the current conditions. "We will be surprised when we read the news in the mass media, usually drug cases that occur in this region have relevance to crime," said Edi. Therefore, according to Edi, Pontianak City Government is committed to continue to establish synergy with BNN Pontianak City every year. "We routinely do urine tests for ASN, truck drivers, workers at nightclubs and cafes. Of the 4600 people we tested, 1 positive person was exposed to drugs," he explained. Edi added that his side also carried out alleviation of a slum area of approximately 24 hectares, through a house, toilet and environmental surgery program. "One of the locations of our program is Kampong Beting. We strive for this village to be an organized and orderly area, not slums," said Edi. At present, Pontianak has a population of around 664,000 people, divided into 6 districts, 29 villages. Beting Village is located in East Pontianak Subdistrict, a third largest area in Pontianak and is very dense. Edi hopes that through collaboration with the city government in the future BNN can eliminate the stigma of Kampung Beting as a drug-prone area.
